required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Clinical Biocompatibility Evaluation of Contact Lens Coatings
clinical_study.official_title: Clinical Biocompatibility Evaluation of Contact Lens Coatings

brief_summary.textblock: The primary objective is to evaluate corneal staining observed after 2 hours of wear with contact lenses with investigational coating against PureVision™ lenses, all pre-cycled with OPTI-FREE® RepleniSH® multi-purpose disinfection solution.

detailed_description.textblock: In this contralateral crossover study, qualifying subjects will wear a total of 2 pairs of study contact lenses. Lenses will be worn according to a randomized lens sequence assignment. Each pair will consist of a test lens (Test 1 or Test 2) and a control lens.

primary_outcome.measure: Average Percent Area of Solution-related Corneal Staining
primary_outcome.time_frame: Day 1 after 2 hours of wear, each product
primary_outcome.description: Percent of solution-related corneal staining area was assessed first in each of the 5 corneal regions: central, superior, nasal, inferior, and temporal. The average of corneal staining area was then calculated as the average over all 5 regions. A higher percentage reflects more damage to the corneal surface. Both eyes contributed to the analysis. No hypotheses were formulated; no inferences were made and only descriptive statistics were used in the reporting.

arm_group.description: Contact lens with investigational coating 1 in right eye, with balafilcon A contact lens in left eye during Period 1, followed by balafilcon A contact lens in right eye, with contact lens with investigational coating 2 in left eye during Period 2. Each lens pair worn contralaterally for approximately 2 hours, with 2 to 8 days between pairs.

Contact lens with investigational coating 2 in right eye, with balafilcon A contact lens in left eye during Period 1, followed by balafilcon A contact lens in right eye, with contact lens with investigational coating 1 in left eye during Period 2. Each lens pair worn contralaterally for approximately 2 hours, with 2 to 8 days between pairs.

Balafilcon A contact lens in right eye, with contact lens with investigational coating 1 in left eye during Period 1, followed by contact lens with investigational coating 2 in right eye, with balafilcon A contact lens in left eye during Period 2. Each lens pair worn contralaterally for approximately 2 hours, with 2 to 8 days between pairs.

Balafilcon A contact lens in right eye, with contact lens with investigational coating 2 in left eye during Period 1, followed by contact lens with investigational coating 1 in right eye, with balafilcon A contact lens in left eye during Period 2. Each lens pair worn contralaterally for approximately 2 hours, with 2 to 8 days between pairs.

intervention.description: Contact lens with investigational coating 1 pre-cycled in OPTI-FREE® RepleniSH® Multi-Purpose Disinfecting Solution (MPDS)
Balafilcon A contact lens pre-cycled OPTI-FREE® RepleniSH® MPDS
Contact lens with investigational coating 2 pre-cycled in OPTI-FREE® RepleniSH® MPDS

overall_official.last_name: Sr. Clinical Manager, Trial Management Operations

participant_flow.recruitment_details: Subjects were recruited from 1 study center located in the United States (US).
participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: All 33 subjects enrolled were randomized. This reporting group includes all randomized subjects (33).

group.title: Test 1/Control 1, Then Control 2/Test 2
group.description: Contact lens with investigational coating 1 in right eye, with balafilcon A contact lens in left eye during Period 1, followed by balafilcon A contact lens in right eye, with contact lens with investigational coating 2 in left eye during Period 2. Each lens pair worn contralaterally for approximately 2 hours, with 2 to 8 days between pairs.

group.title: Test 2/Control 2, Then Control 1/Test 1
group.description: Contact lens with investigational coating 2 in right eye, with balafilcon A contact lens in left eye during Period 1, followed by balafilcon A contact lens in right eye, with contact lens with investigational coating 1 in left eye during Period 2. Each lens pair worn contralaterally for approximately 2 hours, with 2 to 8 days between pairs.

group.title: Control 1/Test 1, Then Test 2/Control 2
group.description: Balafilcon A contact lens in right eye, with contact lens with investigational coating 1 in left eye during Period 1, followed by contact lens with investigational coating 2 in right eye, with balafilcon A contact lens in left eye during Period 2. Each lens pair worn contralaterally for approximately 2 hours, with 2 to 8 days between pairs.

group.title: Control 2/Test 2, Then Test 1/Control 1
group.description: Balafilcon A contact lens in right eye, with contact lens with investigational coating 2 in left eye during Period 1, followed by contact lens with investigational coating 1 in right eye, with balafilcon A contact lens in left eye during Period 2. Each lens pair worn contralaterally for approximately 2 hours, with 2 to 8 days between pairs.

baseline.population: This analysis population includes all subjects exposed to any study lens (Safety Analysis Set).

group.title: Overall
group.description: Contact lens with investigational coatings and balafilcon A contact lens worn contralaterally during Period 1 and Period 2.

class.title: Native Hawaiian or Other Pacific Islander

outcome.title: Average Percent Area of Solution-related Corneal Staining
outcome.description: Percent of solution-related corneal staining area was assessed first in each of the 5 corneal regions: central, superior, nasal, inferior, and temporal. The average of corneal staining area was then calculated as the average over all 5 regions. A higher percentage reflects more damage to the corneal surface. Both eyes contributed to the analysis. No hypotheses were formulated; no inferences were made and only descriptive statistics were used in the reporting.
outcome.time_frame: Day 1 after 2 hours of wear, each product
outcome.population: This analysis population includes all randomized subjects who satisfied protocol-specified criteria (Full Analysis Set).

group.title: Test 1
group.description: Contact lens with investigational coating 1 worn for approximately 2 hours during Period 1 or Period 2

group.title: Control 1
group.description: Balafilcon A contact lens worn contralaterally to Test 1 for approximately 2 hours during Period 1 or Period 2

group.title: Test 2
group.description: Contact lens with investigational coating 2 worn for approximately 2 hours during Period 1 or Period 2

group.title: Control 2
group.description: Balafilcon A contact lens worn contralaterally to Test 2 for approximately 2 hours during Period 1 or Period 2

measure.title: Average Percent Area of Solution-related Corneal Staining
measure.description: Percent of solution-related corneal staining area was assessed first in each of the 5 corneal regions: central, superior, nasal, inferior, and temporal. The average of corneal staining area was then calculated as the average over all 5 regions. A higher percentage reflects more damage to the corneal surface. Both eyes contributed to the analysis. No hypotheses were formulated; no inferences were made and only descriptive statistics were used in the reporting.
measure.population: This analysis population includes all randomized subjects who satisfied protocol-specified criteria (Full Analysis Set).

reported_events.time_frame: Baseline through study completion, approximately 8 days
reported_events.desc: An adverse event (AE) is any untoward medical occurrence, unintended disease or injury, or untoward clinical signs in subjects, users, or other persons, whether or not related to the investigational medical device. AEs were obtained through solicited and spontaneous comments from subjects and through observations by the Investigator as outlined in the study protocol. Safety Analysis Set, based on treatment-specific exposure.

group.title: Test 1
group.description: All subjects exposed to contact lens with investigational coating 1 during Period 1 or Period 2

group.title: Test 2
group.description: All subjects exposed to contact lens with investigational coating 2 during Period 1 or Period 2

group.title: Control
group.description: All subjects exposed to balafilcon A contact lens during Period 1 or Period 2

certain_agreements.pi_employee: All Principal Investigators ARE employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: There is NOT an agreement between Principal Investigators and the Sponsor (or its agents) that restricts the PI's rights to discuss or publish trial results after the trial is completed.

point_of_contact.name_or_title: Sr CDMA Project Lead, GCRA - Vision Care
